Ken, are you still planning to release the source code for iterated ES Hype=
rNEAT?  

Tony Wilson
(new member)

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Ken" <kst=
anley@...> wrote:
>
> Sebastian Risi and I are pleased to announce our new =
GECCO paper (to appear), "Enhancing ES-HyperNEAT to Evolve More Complex Reg=
ular Neural Networks":
> 
> http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/papers/risi_gecco11.pdf=

> 
> Abstract: http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/publications/2011/risi.gecco11.html=

> 
> This paper improves upon the ES-HyperNEAT algorithm (which evolves th=
e placement and density of neurons on the substrate in addition to connecti=
vity) that was introduced last year to make it significantly faster and eas=
ier to apply in practice.  The new enhancement iteratively searches only th=
rough cross-sections of the hypercube instead of through the entire hypercu=
be at once.  Also, while last year's work only showed that ES-HyperNEAT can=
 perform as well as regular HyperNEAT, this work shows that ES-HyperNEAT ha=
s an advantage on some problems, in particular when progressive elaboration=
 of network structure is useful.
> 
> Figure 8 on page 8 shows a nice examp=
le of a progression of networks over evolution that illustrates why evolvin=
g the substrate is promising.
> 
> We are planning to release source code f=
or the evolvable substrate before this year's GECCO.
> 
> ken
>
